newsitem.title: USA: Semiconductor Laser says awarded contract.
newsitem.headline: Semiconductor Laser says awarded contract.

text.p: Semiconductor Laser International Corp said Thursday the Defense Special Weapons Agency (DSWA) of the Department of Defense awarded the company with a research contract.

The contract, which is split into two phases, calls for research on high power visible semiconductor diode lasers for exploratory development of laser-supported technology that will support the agency's physical security missions.
The company projects that the year-long first phase of the contract will produce revenue of approximately $350,000.
Phase II is expected to last an additional six months.
The DSWA serves as the Department of Defense's center for nuclear and advanced weapons effects expertise.
SLI manufactures high power semiconductor lasers.
